sentences.english: Hu Shi's value system of scientific education was characterized by pure science.
sentences.chinese: 胡适的科学教育价值观是以惟科学主义为特征的。

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modem literature.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅与胡适是新文学的开创者与奠基人。

sentences.english: Hu Shi's methodology of history implied two aspects: technical and spiritual.
sentences.chinese: 胡适的历史方法内涵展现在技术和精神两个层面上。

sentences.english: Hushi's translation ideas rise in his literary proposition .
sentences.chinese: 胡适之译学理念发轫于其文学主张。

sentences.english: This paper attempts to analyse the split reason from the position of Hushi for New Culture Movement.
sentences.chinese: 本文从胡适对新文化运动的主张试分析其分裂的原因。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese poem, Hu Shi's A Collection of Attempting Modern Langnage Poem is a sign of new era.
sentences.chinese: 在我国诗歌史上，胡适《尝试集》是划时代的标志。

sentences.english: Hu Shi's Experiment has epitomized these tendencies.
sentences.chinese: 胡适的《尝试集》就缩影着这种发展趋势。

sentences.english: The Chinese literature conception of Hushi was shaped in that term.
sentences.chinese: 胡适的中国文学观主要就是在这一时期形成的。

sentences.english: As a thinker, Hu Shi's thought of law is very abundant.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个思想家，胡适的法律思想非常丰富。

sentences.english: Hu Shih s thought of multiparty politics came into being during his study in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美国留学期间，胡适形成了“多党政治”的思想。

sentences.english: Hu Shis viewpoints have some positive significance.
sentences.chinese: 胡适的观点有一定的积极意义。

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modern literature.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅与胡适是新文学的开创者与奠基人。

sentences.english: The second chapter is on the criticism against Hushi.
sentences.chinese: 第二章写史学领域的胡适批判。

definition: Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Ku Hung-ming or Gu Hongming (1857-1928), Malaysian man of letters, highly regarded for his literary works written mostly in English, and known for his monarchist views
Xu Zhimo (1897-1931), writer and poet
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
